review:
The app does not allow you to move a direct debit from one Bank  of Scot account to another  in the same account holders name Telephone  banking doesn‚Äôt allow it either. You need to go to a branch and very few staff work in branch meaning long waits.
I discovered this when l could not do it online. Phoned the contact centre to get the most unhelpful person who spent one hour talking to me advising of all she couldn‚Äôt do. I had to go to a branch and after the wait the matter was sorted . The bank provides contradictory‚Äôs advice. Contact centre advises it‚Äôs the customers job to contact the company to be paid by direct debit however the branch can transfer a DD from one account to another.
Online banking cannot do this.
Let‚Äôs look at this please and bear in mind Customer Service is important 
ONE hour into a contact centre to be provided with no assistance is unacceptable
title: Good but always ways to improve
developerResponse: {'id': 24554317, 'body': "Thank you for your review, we were pleased to hear you go the issues with your online banking sorted out following your visit to branch. Since you left this review in 2019, we've made a lot of improvements to our app. We'd love to know what you think. ~ Emma", 'modified': '2021-08-17T10:50:01Z'}

review:
All I want is to be able to come on the app and see plainly my accounts and their balances.

Instead all you log on and see is a messy interface with ads, irrelevant information modules I don‚Äôt need or want to see and buttons all over the place. It‚Äôs a mess. I just want it to be simple. Log in, see my accounts on the page with no ads or boxes separating them unnecessarily. If you want to give information out them on a separate page cause the extra ad boxes and icons just make your homepage look a confusing mess of an interface. It‚Äôs just not needed. Neither are the new ‚Äúquick buttons‚Äù or whatever they are that now show under each account. They just clutter the page and make it look messy. They aren‚Äôt needed, these options were easily accessed in the regular way prior.

It‚Äôs funny that this is not shown on your App Store screenshots either. THIS is what I want, what you advertise it looking like on the App Store, but that‚Äôs not what it looks like in real life, it looks like that with boxes and ads in between all your accounts with no way of turning this off or opting out.
title: Messy interface
developerResponse: {'id': 24554303, 'body': "Thank you for your review. We work hard to ensure that our app is simple and easy to use.  We'll be sure to pass your improvement suggestions to our development teams. ~ Emma\r", 'modified': '2021-08-17T10:49:08Z'}

review:
Your Private Banking service has caused me to believe that customers with substantial sums at the bank are neglected and overlooked.
I have this impression after years of loyalty with BoS.
Other banks are so much more customer focussed, looking at ways of assisting in increasing wealth and security. I have only ever experienced BoS as a bank of self-interest. Nobody has even asked what I would want to do with the millions lying practically dormant in a deposit account.
My recent experience of communication, especially with regarding to a recent major bank account fraud has left me wondering where I should transfer all my funds as the security procedures in the bank are not as solid as advertised and you are simply not interested in me as a private banking customer.
title: No contact

review:
Having received a message from a recipient to say that the payment I had sent had not been received, I looked on my app to see the payment hadn‚Äôt been recorded as sent.  If I had looked closer at that point, I would have noticed my balance had changed although payee not recorded.  I paid her again - still no record on the app.  I checked balance to see both payments had been debited.   I contacted the bank to be told that the app wouldn‚Äôt be updated until 1st July because it was the end of the month and the weekend üò±.   The transaction has not shown up in the payee‚Äôs account and her balance hasn‚Äôt changed.   I was advised to check my desktop.  I don‚Äôt have my account on the desktop and it is a busy Sunday morning.  
This app is not an improvement on the previous one and I am left to ponder where in the ether my double payment is - left my account, not in the payee‚Äôs account, although both times I was informed payment was successful and would appear in the recipient‚Äôs account immediately.
title: Updates are antiquated
developerResponse: {'id': 24554308, 'body': "Thank you for getting in touch, and we hope that this transaction issue was resolved for you.  Since you left this review in 2019, we've made a lot of improvements to our app. We'd love to know what you think. ~ Emma\r", 'modified': '2021-08-17T10:49:25Z'}

review: Don‚Äôt even attempt to call them to help or explain why you can not transfer YOUR money. Apparently it‚Äôs a bug but zero explanation or time given for a fix! Only exasperated by the fact it‚Äôs week three and my new card still hasn‚Äôt arrived nor was it ordered three weeks ago AGAIN don‚Äôt expect an explanation or a reason because Bank of Scotland apparently don‚Äôt provide reasons, just a poor banking service. However, the rude call handler will transfer your money for you, it only takes 11 minutes and you get the pleasure of speaking to someone with a bad attitude and complete lack of social skills but hey you also get to be reminded repeatedly that you can also just log on using a PC. Hello 2018
title: Poor app. Poor service.
developerResponse: {'id': 24554326, 'body': "Thank you for your review, and we were sorry to hear about the concerns  you had in 2018.  We have made a lot of improvement to our app since that time, and we'd love to know what you think. ~ Emma", 'modified': '2021-08-17T10:50:44Z'}

review:
It‚Äôs crazy that, in this day and age, to utilise the app for paying off your credit card you have to open a bank of Scotland current account. I already have 3 current accounts - I don‚Äôt need another one just to appease bos! So as a result I‚Äôm in unable to pay off any of my credit card balance without logging in and paying through the website. And for someone that clears off balances whenever I have free funds ad-hoc (not a specific regular direct debit which is the only option for me) is incredibly inconvenient. Very poor. 

Please allow debit card payments to pay off credit card balances in-app! Barclaycard‚Äôs app was FAR more user friendly than this app which is basically just a balance checker unless you also take out their current account, pay into that from your main current account THEN pay the credit card balance from in the app! Bonkers system. Sort it out. At this stage i regret the move from Barclaycard MASSIVELY.
title: Support for non BOS payments
developerResponse: {'id': 6616295, 'body': 'Hi, thanks for leaving us a review. We are always looking at ways to improve the App and your feedback is appreciated. Simon', 'modified': '2018-12-31T11:07:39Z'}

review:
This most recent iteration of the B of S app. shows continued innovative efficient development, delivering a tool that is a pleasure to use and appears to be at the cutting edge of the modern technology, and to me, so way ahead of the other banks that I use.
A high level of common sense has been brought to bear to deliver security you can trust, whilst keeping it at a minimal and simple to use level.
With other competitors I find that, in their efforts to demonstrate high security, the process has become confusing, laborious and time wasting!
Congratulations to B of S, whom I am proud to have stuck with, through thick and thin, since I joined at the age of 19, when I first went to Dundee University, in October 1972!
title: Bank of Scotland banking App.
developerResponse: {'id': 24554334, 'body': "Thank you for your review!  We were pleased to hear that you are proud to bank with us.  We've made a lot more improvements to our app since you left this review in 2019, we'd love to know what you think. ~ Emma", 'modified': '2021-08-17T10:51:10Z'}

review: Ok, hopefully now I have your attention developers? I added 2 other credit card accounts to this app 3 months ago (so that I can view those balances without moving out of 1 app to open another..a really good idea and USP by the way) all worked well until the 3 month re- authorisation rolled around a few weeks ago. I reauthorised my MBNA credit card account with no problems, ie: click the link in BOS app to open MBNA app to confirm authorisation then get taken back to BOS app... seamless, quick and secure. When I tried the same with my Barclaycard though.... oops! Instead of being redirected back to my BOS app my Halifax banking app gets opened automatically instead (and obviously the request to add Barclaycard to my open banking is never actioned)! I realise this may be a Barclaycard app issue but as the initial request originated from the BOS app then I guess it‚Äôs down to you to solve.
title: Open banking module seems insecure
developerResponse: {'id': 24554346, 'body': "Thank you for getting in touch, and we hope that this  issue has since been resolved for you.  Since you left this review in 2020, we've made a lot of improvements to our app. We'd love to know what you think. ~ Emma\r", 'modified': '2021-08-17T10:51:53Z'}

review: I find this app on my large screen iPhone is better and easier than using my PC, whether it‚Äôs checking transactions, making payments or managing standing orders and direct debits. (I use a PC double boot system on the PC so banking is done on a dedicated operating system rather than sharing with risky internet browsing - a safer and necessary ‚Äòfaff‚Äô.) The app is clear and functional, ideal for parallel viewing of account details and my own finance spreadsheets at the same time. The occasional need to check an account while out and about is easy using the selective password system and 4G (not someone else‚Äôs Wi-Fi, I hasten to add).
title: Happy Happy!
developerResponse: {'id': 24554343, 'body': "Thank you for your review!  We were pleased to hear that our app has made banking easier for you.  We've continued to make improvements to our app since you left this review in 2018, we'd love to know what you think. ~ Emma\r", 'modified': '2021-08-17T10:51:36Z'}

review: BoS app is best internet bank app I have used so far. Very good as it allows account view, transfers, set up & manage standing orders plus quite a few features not on my other bank apps. Able to see upcoming payments too. Update to send notifications when transactions made in or out of account is a good addition. After a new account set up was able to see it after using the 'New +' button in My accounts. Most things are intuitive but some changes take me a bit of time to adjust to.
title: BoS bank app is good

review:
Do not even bother to download & try to use this app as it is useless. You cannot print directly from it as you could from the previous BoS app unless you go to the bother of creating a separate pdf file each time you want to print your up to date income and expenditure. You cannot see two separate columns showing incomings and outgoings as you could on the previous app, but instead there is just one column which has plus and minus signs beside each amount. Useless for anyone. The Bank of Scotland should be ashamed to have produced this. It is a backward step.
When I complained to the BoS about its shortcomings I was told to log in to my account via a web browser, so what exactly is the point of this app?
title: Useless app

review: I haven‚Äôt been able to even get onto the app! So I can‚Äôt actually write a review on the app itself but getting set up I‚Äôve had the worst experience. I set it up like normal and had my memorable information sorted and everything but when I was asked to log in after setting up it asked for the 7th letter of my memorable info when my memorable Information was a 6 lettered word. So I changed it over the phone, once tried again didn‚Äôt work. Changed it again over the phone twice this time deleting the app then downloading it again and it still didn‚Äôt work so I tried phoning up customer service and was left on hold for two hours so I gave up and tried a third time and now I‚Äôm locked out the account and despite me phoning up to get locked out like it told me to. That didn‚Äôt work either.
title: Terrible service

If you could include what you have and not been able to do, this will be a great help. Simon.", 'modified': '2019-01-29T13:29:29Z'}

review: Very irritating indeed . I was locked out of the App as the fingerprint unlock on my iPad was legitimately changed to include my Wife‚Äôs. As a precaution ( wisely ) it locked me out . My ‚Äú memorable information‚Äù  is lost in the dim and distant , and so when I try to change the ‚Äú memorable information, it will not recognise my first character in the confirmation of my change, and hence the memorable information does not match. Tried this five times in succession. Is this deliberate. Bank of Scotland take away our local branches , and give us Apps that don‚Äôt work as a sop.
title: Very Irritating

review: I found this app to be absolutely invaluable, my daughter helped me initially set this up but just 2 clicks and you‚Äôre there absolutely wonderful no more forgetting cards in stores ec cetera no longer searching the house after I do an online with my card then can‚Äôt find it the next again day!! I‚Äôm sure the bank would help people set it up on an app but if you have an Apple IPHONE like I do, then goTo a local Apple Store near you and there are lessons on how to do it yourself, I hope this helpsüí´
title: Brain Injured Person
developerResponse: {'id': 24871367, 'body': "Hi, and thanks for your review. We are pleased you find our app so helpful. Full details of this provision can be found through our website, or by visiting www.bankofscotland.co.uk/aboutonline  ~ Emma", 'modified': '2021-09-02T12:47:32Z'}

review: This app is very good and very helpful. The reason I'm refraining from giving 5* is that I have had a lot of issues with requesting a change of address and/or a change of PIN. For some reason, the registered address of a savings account is stored separately from the registered address of a credit card that is tied to the same account (god knows why BoS does it this way). For a very long time, the app just used to give me an error when I was submitting such request and the only way was to call (long wait on the phone but that's a different matter). I finally got the right address in through the phone.
title: Very good overall
developerResponse: {'id': 2455930, 'body': 'Thanks for the feedback and apologies for any inconvenience. Anthony.', 'modified': '2018-01-31T10:24:24Z'}

review: The app is fine and works pretty well but I always got annoyed that the displayed amount that I have in my account never took off the money in my pending transactions, always leaving me thinking I had more money than I did. I could look at the available section and do a bit of maths in my head to work out how much I had and how much was my overdraft but it was annoying and I could never work out a reason for it being like this. Then the other day I was delighted to see they had updated the app to automatically take the pending transactions out of the amount, only for them then to go back to the old way the next day? Why?!
title: Made better then made worse?

review: With the old App, now discontinued, I was able to regularly check details of investments which had been recommended to me by HBOS financial advisers. With the new App, this information is not now available because the Bank in which I hold the investments is not listed. The new App has effectively reduced the level of service provided. While other functions of the new App are the same as with the old, as an online customer, I consider I am now less well served. It certainly doesn‚Äôt feel like an improvement to me.
title: Accessing Investment details

review: I use online banking all the time and this brings it to a whole new level. I have an iphone 7. An excellent app with which I've found no issues. It's quick, extremely easy and really brings your banking to your fingertips. Security seems spot on too, with all steps taken for the users protection. New fingerprint security makes it all the sweeter to use. Don't hesitate to use this great wee tool. You won't regret it.  I see some reviews saying it doesn't work. Nonsense!!!
title: Excellent app at your fingertips!

review:
This app works well enough for day to day actions, transfers, and checking accounts. However nestled between your accounts there is constantly adverts show... ‚Äòbank of Scotland is secure‚Äô and offers for overdrafts and more accounts. I‚Äôm already a BoS customer, I don‚Äôt care about these... I‚Äôm already a customer. I know who to ask for more service, which I can do as and when I need them. They get frustrating.
Accounts can be renamed, however not via the app which isn‚Äôt the end of the world, you do this once. The account names do show in the app. Supports face recognition unlock, and you can see your statements.
title: Adverts everywhere!!

review:
The BoS app is very easy to use and easy to navigate around the different functions. 
I like the dashboard at the top of home page where you can easily slide between your different accounts. I also like the money available information being presented so you don‚Äôt have to deduct your pending payments from shown balance.
I have give this app 4 stars as I quite often receive the message saying the app is experiencing technical problems which can be frustrating when I want to make a transfer whilst it‚Äôs fresh in my head.
title: Easy to use
developerResponse: {'id': 24554350, 'body': "Thank you for your review!  We were pleased to hear that you find our app easy to use.  We've continued to make improvements to our app since you left this review in 2018, we'd love to know what you think. ~ Emma", 'modified': '2021-08-17T10:52:08Z'}

review: BOS banking app is a great app but why can‚Äôt I have fingerprint login on my iPad Pro like I can on my iPhone. I‚Äôve been asking this for around 2yrs now either by email or letter, what ever that is, and have not had a single reply so I‚Äôm not expecting one here either!! It must be simple enough if I can even use face recognition on my iPhone Xs Max now. The BOS is the only bank app I can‚Äôt use fingerprint authentication on my iPad Pro. The other banking apps I use have it so why is BOS so far behind (at least 2yrs) the competition?
title: Best banking app going

review: We have only been customers with the bank since the end of November this year. I have been unable to use my card online. My husband has no problem!! I have used my card to withdraw cash & contactless. Bearing in mind the time of year & a family to buy for be it food or Xmas presents I am frustrated & annoyed. Have tried contact the bank by phone. Just yesterday I spent 18 minutes waiting on the phone & when I finally got through I was told she couldn‚Äôt help me & transferred me to another department which I then spent another ONE HOUR before hanging up!!! All chat on the website was no help either only advising me to call the help line!!!!! VERY DISAPPOINTED customer.
title: Customer Service

review:
Have Banked with them since 1962 with a small break when I worked in Canada I can understand why they are shutting branches l find on line banking very convenient if I do have a problem your 24hr phone banking is very helpfull I have even used it from New Zealand I got the problem sorted out in 5min
I also find the local branch very helpfull the service I have received now is far better than it was 25 years ago.
          Regards,
         Donald Wemyss  ( age 75)
title: Donald wemyss

review: Love how easy it is to create new transfers and move money about between accounts. As it‚Äôs the app it fits perfectly on the screen and works much better than using just a browser online. If you leave it for a second it automatically logs you out so you know even if your phone was stolen you would still be safe. You can also put it to log in with your fingerprint and that works really quickly.
title: Quick and easy

review: This is a magnificent app by Bank of Scotland.  I use it daily on my iPad or iPhone to keep track of my bank account and credit card balances, without the hassle of logging on to a desktop or laptop.  You can check balances, pay bills, move money, create new payees, delete direct debits and virtually everything else you would do via a desktop computer, all whilst on the go, if you fancy.  It's easy to log in too, yet appears very secure.  I can't fault the app at all and would thoroughly recommend it..
title: Superb Facilities

review: I haven‚Äôt been able to amend my overdraft. Not because it‚Äôs declined but when using the app and filling out the details required it then comes up saying that to finalise the request I have to call bank of Scotland. Calling them takes forever and when I phoned to query why the application was not being processed on the app I was given very little help and a dismissive attitude. The service of an overdraft and the ease to control the amount both up and down is a great freedom I have enjoyed over the years and now with it not working and a dismissive service on the phone I am very frustrating. To call them and amend your overdraft takes about 25-30 mins as opposed to 2mins on the app.
title: Service is no good

review: Having banked with B of S for 50 years this is the first time I haven‚Äôt been able to successfully move forward with new technology. Over 2 days I tried at least 16 times to change from the previous app which I have had no problems with. Niall in the call centre was extremely helpful but still I couldn‚Äôt access my accounts! I am going abroad on holiday in 3 days so this was a very inconvenient time for problems. I hope if I call in personally at my branch tomorrow they will be able to assist.
title: 4 hours !!

review: I have been using the Halifax app for a while but got a new phone recently and updated my bank of Scotland app to use that. Since then, only a a few weeks ago, there have been several occasions when I haven‚Äôt been able to access the app with a variety of messages being shown ‚Äòtechnical difficulties‚Äô being the most frequent. Although at times the Halifax app has had the same error at the same time I have been able to access this on occasions where I couldn‚Äôt access BOS app
title: Glitches in App?

review: Only recently, did I become aware that not all banks have this quality of service! Totally took it for granted until I tried to help someone with their online banking. It couldn‚Äôt do half the things that are so easily done with Bank of Scotland. Pay in checks, transfer money, checking accounts. All really easy. And I‚Äôm not very techie. It‚Äôs easy to set up and functionality is the best!
title: Excellent service

review: Love my banking with BOS, however, there seems to be a trust issue from you guys....my account has never been in the ‚Äòred‚Äô in all the years I have been a Customer. I‚Äôve also in the past had a now completely paid off mortgage with you, so when I called to ask if I could arrange a short term overdraft, only to be told after all of my information was given, that it wasn‚Äôt possible as my address was in Spain......
title: Review

review:
So this app is easy
To access, let‚Äôs you keep on top of your finances , let‚Äôs you transfer money or pay someone. Well it does, when it works and it doesn‚Äôt work a lot of the time. Getting fed up with the uselessness of this app and am seriously considering moving to Virgin. Their app works very well, does what it‚Äôs supposed to, gives advance warnings if it‚Äôs going to be offline in other words completely the opposite of BOS. I have tried unsuccessfully all day to pay my visa bill. Come on BOS. get this right.
title: Could be better

review: A recent version introduced a change so you cannot download PDF statements anymore. Go into your Inbox and click one of the statement messages. You get to a page that has a ‚Äúdownload as PDF‚Äù button. Click that and you can see the PDF, but the ability to actually download the file has been removed because somebody has removed the share button. Clearly whoever made this change has no clue how iOS works, but without a share button all users can do is look at the PDF. Bring back the share button!!!
title: No more downloadable statements
developerResponse: {'id': 26496862, 'body': "Hi, thanks for letting us know about this issue. We're aware of this and will be releasing a fix soon. Thanks for your patience in the meantime. ~ Emma", 'modified': '2021-11-26T14:21:12Z'}

review: Since lock down of Covid 19 joining on line banking has helped enormously in maintaining gods social distancing and at the same time gives me live news re money movement and spending information. This allows myself to keep a close track of my finances. Great app although being of the older generation I‚Äôm always scared of the security of my bank and account details being hacked. I guess only time will tell.
title: Mr D O‚ÄôDonnell

review: This is a very useful, user friendly, easily accessed, quick to use app. Download  it and grab yourself some really useful flexibility and control of your accounts. Best of the various apps I use with providers to conduct my banking. Focus here is on functionality and ease of use - not how colourful and ‚Äòhip‚Äô it looks. Good to have both but otherwise I‚Äôd go for functionality every time.
title: Brilliant App

review: Keeps logging you out of the app and asks you to sign in as someone that‚Äôs never used the app before, Face ID turned on and it still asks for passwords and memorable info that nobody remembers 5 Boody years later, so checking you‚Äôre balance takes about 20 min after all the confirming emails, calls with pins and putting in silly passcodes that does nothing but cause stress! Sort out your app bank of Scotland! God sake üò°
title: Bank of Delay

review:
The BOS bank app is one of the biggest life changing additions to the banking sector this century. It is easy to use and gives you great access 24/7.
Though I don‚Äôt want to see the end of the high street branch because they are still useful. I understand the costs are high, but possible high street branches can diversify and be a front shop for all services.
title: Bank App

review:
I love this app . I love I can do my banking checks, transfers , planning etc when it‚Äôs convenient to me . App is easy to get around . There‚Äôs lots of little features that make keeping on top of your finances easier , like the date scroll to and from , what‚Äôs expected to and from etc 
To be able to cancel direct debits etc straight from app rather than having to call into a branch . I love it .
title: Keeping on top

review: Have used this app for for a long time and it was always convenient however the recent updates have made it even better. As much as I don‚Äôt want high street banks to go, I must admit that I use this app for everything - paying in cheques is soooo easy now! It‚Äôs so simple to use that even computer novices would find it easy I think.
title: Great app

review: No real fault really. Just a little slow at showing payment made to my credit card. Instantly shows amount taken from current account but doesn‚Äôt show payment made to credit card account for a few days. I log in often during those days to make sure payment has been made. Other than that I love the App.
title: Still good

review:
After leaving this review, the app has been updated and has allowed for password pasting. Quite impressed with how quickly this was fixed! There is still no integrated password manager support, but it‚Äôs definitely usable now :)

Below is my original review. 

All the basics are there. Overall quite impressed. 

My only major issue is that there is no password manager support. Since all of my passwords are 25+ characters, it is very annoying to have to type in each character copying from another screen or by popping in and out of the app. It doesn‚Äôt even let you paste a password into the field! 

Other than this, there‚Äôs not much to complain about.
title: Quality app and fast developer feedback
developerResponse: {'id': 3270926, 'body': "Hi, we've enabled pasting passwords in our new updated app. Try updating the app via the app store and try it out. Anthony.", 'modified': '2018-04-29T00:06:15Z'}

review: This is one of the best apps, which I use almost daily, making banking so much easier and hassle free. The only issue I have with the app is the Banks offers and adds that appear between your accounts on the main screen. I don't mind the adds themselves, I wish they would move them to the bottom, after all your accounts.
title: Just gets better

review:
Very easy to use with the correct phone. Fingerprint recognition is wonderful. What used to take time physically going in to a bank (with all that entailed ) is now done in minutes, more easily, more conveniently wherever you are with your phone (so long as you‚Äôve got a signal) 
Brilliant, couldn‚Äôt have imagined this 30 years agoüëç
title: Great app

review:
Yet again I have had to delete and reload this app just to be able to get at and check my account and my money. 
What really brasses me off with this is, that as a result of a dubious transaction, my branch has suggested that I monitor the account closely!
I have moaned about this app in a number of places, yet I have had no feedback whatsoever from the bank.  It‚Äôs becoming apparent that you don‚Äôt really care about your customers, so I think it‚Äôs time for a chat with the guys from Monzo or Starling!  At least they seem to listen and give you the feeling that they do care!
title: Fallen over YET again!

review: I had this app for 1 month it was good for the most part but one day I tried to log in my Touch ID never came up, so then I tried to log in and it says my details are wrong so I tried again and guess what wrong again so after many tries it comes up with a number I could phone so I phoned the number had a talk with a person working at the bank and here I‚Äôm thinking oh there gonna help me I can log on again to check my balance but nope üëé there help was useless not using this app again
title: This app is so bad

review:
Whatever has been done to this app recently has made it almost entirely unworkable on an iPhone 7 running iOS 13.5.2. 

If you open everyday offers, it crashes. Try to open the transaction summary/breakdown, it crashes. Try to look at new accounts, it crashes. Basically, try to do anything other than just look at the most recent transactions on an account, it crashes. 

A fix would be nice!
title: Well, it used to work...

review: This app just keeps getting better. It does almost all I need to do with a banking app. Don‚Äôt bother going anywhere else. The only improvement I can think of is having the ability to add short comments to payments as reminders to be used later.
title: First class app from a first class bank

review:
I use three banks‚Äô apps on a regular basis and this is by far the best. 
So easy to see what‚Äôs coming in and going out, able to make changes and updates in app which other banks don‚Äôt facilitate.
Really easy to use and has excellent options to check upcoming payments. 
Really pleased we opened an account with BOS - customer service and this app are really impressive.
title: Brilliant App!

review:
This app does the basics and is reasonably efficient in the way it goes about it. However:-

1. It is clumsy and poorly-formatted on an iPad - the display is designed purely for the iPhone and the application makes no adjustment for iPad use. 

2. Integration with the fingerprint scanner doesn‚Äôt work on an iPad, but it does work on an iPhone. That makes no sense, unless the underlying programming is sloppy.

3. Occasional connectivity issues, when all other network access is fine. 

If you just need a basic application to check your current account balance and maybe pay a few bills, this should do the job, but it feels like a minimum-effort, me-too response to other banks entering the mobile market. 

No leadership, no innovation. Could do better.
title: Mediocre
developerResponse: {'id': 2563103, 'body': "Thanks for the constructive feedback. We're in the process of re-designing our app and we hope to optimise the screen for larger screened devices as well as enabling TouchID on the iPad. We're hoping to release these features over the next few months so please keep an eye out. Apologies for any inconvenience, Anthony.", 'modified': '2018-02-12T15:01:03Z'}

review: This app is almost perfect. No longer do you need to go through loads of security questions on the telephone, or remember how much your last petrol amount was (to the penny). title: Unable to login

review: The Bank of Scotland‚Äôs personal customer ebusiness has come a long way from the launch of their first app. The current app has all the functionality I need, to move money around, national or international, pay with Apple pay, account status, printing statements directly from my phone and many other functions - well done BoS!

review: This app is unbelievably helpful for online banking! Once you‚Äôve navigated yourself around the app and found out where all the features are then it takes 0.2 seconds to make payments, send details, check how much money you have, switch between accounts, etc. Would highly recommend!!!

developerResponse: {'id': 11928565, 'body': "Hello, we're sorry that you are unhappy with the functionality on the App the reason for the change was that the FCA introduced regulations that all banks must follow, so we‚Äôve had to change how we show your account balance so you can clearly see how much money you have and how much you‚Äôre borrowing. Now you‚Äôll see your actual account balance (including pending transactions) and any arranged overdraft limit separately.\r\nThanks, Darren\r\n", 'modified': '2019-11-19T10:10:46Z'}

I have tried to raise it through BOS but nothing back at all so perhaps one of the developers may read this and realise there is a problem that needs resolving.

title: Mr Bonar

review:
I had made 2 or 3 false starts. When I re-enquired about online banking in your Dumfries branch, the member of staff recognised my oldish-&-not-very-tech-savvy appearance (that‚Äôs a thing by the way) and decided to help me decide passwords and she wrote them for me on a bank of Scotland card which I still have with me (since August 2016). She nailed it for me, and online banking at least with my bank of Scotland accounts, became a reality. And I can‚Äôt begin to tell you how much value I have obtained from it. I wish I had taken her name so I could send a specific thanks.

On a different note, I was sadly disappointed at the lack of support that the bank gave when I had significant losses due to fraud on my account. We changed the card a few times before eventually starting a new account entirely.  I had lost at least ¬£9,000 and possibly up to ¬£12,000. I had cause to learn that some of the same sources of the fraud had carried out other fraud that the bank were aware of. And the format of the losses would have acted as proof as I was told that no games console could physically hold the number of premium games that had been bought. 

Sorry I went off track. I have many reasons to praise the Bank of Scotland, amongst them the kind woman who helped an old-ish man finally come to grips with internet banking. But that particular situation disappointed me as I had seen other banks deal with similar issues more honourably, treating their customer like a client (‚Äòsomeone who is under their care, protection and guidance‚Äô) and felt that Bank of Scotland did very little if anything to help. 

Kind regards 
Yassir Shaheen

review:
Update Sep 12 - still dreadful. The basic account information is there, along with payment functionality (which is very onerous but works). It's just the completely dreadful interface and usability that lets it down so badly. Awkward to log in. Doesn't use familiar IOS button and functionality conventions.  ATM information is wholly inaccurate and unreliable. Really bad menus and navigation. Amateurish and very basic. Typical Lloyds, sadly - take everything to the most basic offering, no value add, no customer consideration. 

Original review July 12 - 
The basic functionality is there, in terms of account viewing, payments, transfers, but the user interface design is decidedly clunky and poorly done. 

It's buggy too - clicking on some of the footer buttons make the app crash. 

And the quality of branch and ATM data is very poor - the Old Broad Street branch is titled "London Old Broad BoS", other banks' ATM's are not identified by bank name, and St Helens WA10 is apparently just a third of a km from London SW10!!

All in all, a disappointingly amateurish offering, clearly done on the cheap without any thought to interface nor innovation.
title: Amateur attempt

review: I'm hugely angry about this update. The old app worked perfectly fine and I resent finding after an update that I have to re-register. It meant being unable to access my accounts to transfer money until I'd returned home to answer an obnoxious automated phonecall that took several attempts to work. The new interface is also terrible - I don't want to 'swipe' between my accounts, it's idiotic. For some reason the app also uses it's own keypad graphic that's harder to use due to the keys flashing too quickly after typing for you to ascertain if you've hit the right character, leading to having to repeatedly re-enter your password as you've got it wrong without realising it. Also, I don't want a quicker login - I liked that I had to enter three different sets of information to access my accounts. My banking being a mere three digits away from anyone with access to my phone doesn't fill me with confidence. Since installing this update accidentally I've repeatedly hesitated from registering as I've been in two minds about whether or not it might actually be a phishing scam. The whole experience has been very unpleasant. This update was an unnecessary frivolity, it's insulting.
title: Completely infuriating

review:
This is a good app. It's definitely one of the better apps available from UK banks. It offers a lot more than just checking balances and doing simple transfers, which is great.

However, it does feel like we're getting to the stage where simply emulating the functionality of online banking on a smaller screen is no longer enough. It's time for mobile banking apps to innovate and add true mobile features. For example, why can I only get alerts by text? Why not let me get iOS notifications for a wider variety of activities? It would be great if I could get an alert every time a payment hits my account, or if I go overdrawn, or if my card is used abroad. And why not let me quickly view my balances in the iOS notification centre, or on my Apple Watch? Going "Mobile-first" is a growing trend, but it's clear it hasn't quite hit Bank of Scotland yet.

Also, the iPhone 6 S is out today. How is it possible that this app still doesn't support the iPhone 6/6 Plus screen sizes?
title: OK, but one year on and still no iPhone 6 screen support?

review:
After I put in my 3 letters the app sometimes tells me it has to log me out without a reason. Very annoying. 

It is a good start and I'm glad to see HBOS finally catching up with mobile browsers. It's not really an app though more a stripped back site. I think it could do with a de clutter and be a bit more intuitive. HBOS should remember who their target market is and know that most people using this app only want to quickly check funds and transfer funds. They also want to do this quickly so it would be a nice feature if once the users logged in with all their credentials then they have the ability to set up a four digit pin number so that next log in, they just enter their pin to log in. O2s app has this and I think it's a great time saver. I hope HBOS is listening to all this feedback
title: A few bugs

review:
I've used this app for a while now but the latest version is by far the worst simply due to the incredibly slow manner in which it starts up. I expect a few seconds but I can sit for 15, 20, often over 30 seconds as the little circle does its thing whilst my device is apparently authenticated. 

I understand the importance of security given the functions of the app but some explanation from the developers as to why there is this significant delay in start up alongside a commitment to ensure it is fixed would go some way to tempering my irritation. It has actually got to the stage that I am considering switching banks as almost all my banking, until recently, has been done using the app. 

For reference, iPhone 6s Plus 64gb, plenty space left, no slowdown of other apps, behaviour replicated on home internet, various work and hotel internet and 3G/4G.
title: This latest version is a retrograde step

review:
Love this new version of the app! Registration was easy and simple and makes the log in so much quicker with only 3 characters of memorable information and you're in. No more calls to authenticate new payees either which makes it faster than the desktop website! I can even update my telephone numbers in the app settings. 
Also using it on my iPad and have no issues at all, it may be a scaled up version of the iPhone app but it doesn't look like it as there is no pixelation of images or text, everything looks sharp, so I've got no idea why people are complaining. 
Well done BoS - It was worth the wait!
title: Impressive new app - fast and easy banking as it should be

review:
App takes too long to start up and open much to my daily annoyance, so much so l considered on many occasions to completely delete it!!! 
The everyday offers is even slower and hate that you have to activate each one individually so many off them each month are never used by myself. 
Once eventually in the app l don't really have much complaints as it pays bills, contacts, transfers etc quickly and effectively so does the job intended, but notifications for balance alerts, direct debits and likes that the SMS alerts offer could be an added bonus, (although maybe the night before instead of silly hours like 4am could be better. The main reason l no longer opt for text alerts!!)
But all in all apart from the slow start up and offers a fab little app, (at times lol.)
title: Glasgow

review: This app is one of those boring apps. Not very exciting, but a must have in the modern world. Over the years it has went from strength to strength and the current version is the best yet. Straight forward and fuss free. Just what you need from a banking app. However, a few wee niggles persist. You cannot view pending transactions, why BoS, why? What is with the ridiculous keyboard? Apple have been doing pretty well in that area since 2007. Don't change things for the sake of it. Also it is almost four months since the iPhone 6 and 6 plus launched. It is about time the resolution of these displays were supported. All in all this is a decent app, which requires just a little bit more polish.
title: Getting better all the time.

review:
Was quite hyped about this new update, due to the ease of access described in the email prior to the release. All in all the interface is looking more efficient, certainly more of an app than a mobile website, however there seem to be a lot of issues regarding the app.

I'm finding difficulty actually getting into the app to start with, every time I've tried it's taken me a couple of times just to get past the login screen, claiming I have no internet connection when in fact I do. Somewhat frustrating if you ask me, reckon you guys have skipped a few hurdles to get this on the market as quick as you can, you guys have some things to work on.
title: Almost there.

review:
I find this app very handy in day-to-day use. You can check the balance of you account, or of multiple accounts if necessary. You can set up and make payments to other people. There is not much else that I do regularly. The log-in process is very straightforward as long as you can remember your memorable information. However, occasionally you fire up the app, and it says that the session has expired (probably due to closing it without logging out) This seems to confuse the app, and you may need to log-in 2 or 3 times before it lets you in. 
In general, however,  I would recommend this app.
title: Useful App

review: This App is one of the best Apps that I have ever downloaded and I just love using it on a regular basis.  The ease of use, the ease of checking your monthly online statements without having to first enter your password, too paying a new contact, checking your monthly direct debits, checking your balance and so much more.  I prefer this App over the desktop version.  I would definitely recommend this App to my family and friends, it has made my life much easier.  Download it right now you will not regret it I promise you.  üëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèº
title: Ease of use, convenient and hassle free....

review:
In my opinion a fantastic app, enhancement made over the time I have used it have increased functionality to the point I never need to contact my branch. An excellent feature for me is the notify when travelling option as I travel within 10 countries continuously, the app allows me to ensure the bank knows where and when I am in country to ensure my card details are safe. 
Very simple to use and use friendly. The option to set log off when you want is superb too, immediately exiting app is best and most secure option üòÉ
title: Fantastic App

review: This app used to be great but since ios 8.3 upgrade which I applied a few days ago to my iPhone 5 it continually does not work now. When the log in screen appears and I input security details the screen disappears and reverts to desk top view. The next attempt results in being logged out. Access is gained on third attempt finally.  My wife has exactly the same issue following her taking the same iOS 8.3 upgrade. We had similar problems with a previous iOS upgrade which were finally resolved when new app was issued. Could somebody from BoS tech dept please examine the issue and apply resolution asap to restore what was a great app for personal banking? Many thanks.
title: Help required

review:
This app is, even in principle, only slightly better than logging on using Safari through the bank's website. In practice it's a complete pain. Again and again errors occur that log you off and return you to the bank's home page. 
Even when you are logged on, you can't necessarily get the information you want concerning your account.
In short, this is a lazily-written app that in many places simply displays web pages in a more awkward way than a standard browser.
It's a free app, but I fear it's not worth what I paid for it. To be worth having it would have to get me the information about my account I want and present it in a way that takes into account the fact that it's being displayed on an iPhone screen
title: Useless

review:
Great update from Lloyds banking group! But I was annoyed it was only first made available for BOS customers, however if you are like me and are fed up of waiting for the halifax release, just register for BOS online banking and you can have access too!

A great update though! Finally a real app, but still a bland background and graphics! More work to be done but still an excellent update! Love the way unlike RBS or Barclays you get an automated call and can set up new payees on the go, instead of messing around with card readers!
title: Halifax customers also can use!

review: It's a fine app I don't know why everyone complains it does exactly what it says it should I don't have any problems with crashing or it being slow (maybe update your phone if your having trouble) it was tedious navigating the web page and the app just makes it much easier to quickly log in, stop with the negative reviews it's there first attempt and a heck of alot better than some 1* apps on the AppStore and it's free so you can't really complain just delete it if it's so bad!!!!
title: Great

review: Title of the review says it all- since recent updates over the past few months, this app is now the most straightforward to use customer friendly app I know of, and even my friends and family who are not with BoS think so. I had issues with the bank for years in general and was in the verge of moving banks, but this app is so easy and others seem so awkward that I have stayed. Cannot beat convenient safe and simple access to my bank!
title: Great to use app-simple and comprehensive

review:
I cannot understand some of negative feedback. Does it do all the basics I would expect quickly - yes. Is it easy to navigate - yes. The only info lacking is a summary of major ins/outs in past month and transaction info over longer period.
It really isn't difficult to type in password and select three characters from a second passphrase. A PIN is far less secure and is prone to hacking/trojans which when phones are easily/lost stolen is not a sensible alternative.
Nice app which would have got 5 stars if it hadn't taken this long to launch!
title: Very good app

review: Why are people falling to their knees to give this app 5 stars? Yes, most of the useful functionality is there. But the execution is fairly abysmal. Needs a serious makeover for iOS8 to bring it into line with contemporary app design. The design as it stands is drab, ugly, and the interaction lags after button presses. Login and authentication takes twice as long as the Santander app. It doesn't even use the iOS keyboard, contributing to a generally tacky feel. This app makes me glad I signed up with Santander - yes their mobile app has one or two fewer features but at least it has a look & feel that belongs in this century. And it's fast. BoS, you need to get a grip with your mobile offering. Did I really wait a week for my password in the post for this?
title: Needs a Serious Makeover

review: This app always works. The only time I personally have ever had an issue with it is if I'm out of signal. It has never crashed, frozen, displayed an error message, or any other faults you may think of. It makes checking your balance and transaction history so simple. Transferring funds is a doddle and totally secure, I don't know where I would be without my banking app. Such a simple little thing now playing a big part in my day to day life.
title: Easy and simple. Never had a problem.

review: The app works brilliantly. So easy to log in (yet is secure with using TouchID) and to use to view balances and move money. The one thing I'd love though is to be able to add a reference to transfers between accounts (like you can when making a payment) It would make keeping track of what I've moved money around for so much easier. Often I forget why I moved money around my different accounts. A short reference added would help enormously.
title: Brilliant app, one suggestion

review:
Very easy to keep track of my finances on a regular basis.  You can pay a contact, check standing orders and direct debits, transfer money to another account and now even view my pending transactions. 

Once the device is registered;  it's only my memorable information required to access my accounts.  The app also signs you out after brief inactivity which means you don't have to worry about the security of others viewing accounts. 

Recommend this app
title: Secure & easy

review: This the second review I've given, the apps getting better all the time, my first review asked about more control over direct debits and standing orders from within the app, thats been done in updates, really easy to use and simple to switch between accounts, like the last review i added one more feature would make it perfect, that would be the ability to alert the bank to stolen or lost cards with the tap of a button
title: Really useful app

review:
I downloaded this app to allow me to manage my bank account and payments whilst being mobile. I'm not a computer geek so I just wanted something that was simple and secure. This app fits the bill. It allows me to send bank transfers, set up new bank transfers, view bank statements, pay my BofS credit card and a host of other features.

I'm sure it will not change your life and I doubt you will leap for joy if you do download it but it does exactly what it is supposed to do.
title: Spot on!

review:
This update is fantastic! I read one very negative review. I use I phone and don't know if its different on another phone. 
Really quick to log in which is perfect on the go. I often use app banking when away from home and found the 3 step scroll down process a frustrating pain. Live the single access keyboard. Always felt that bank of Scotland lagged behind the other banks with the customer IT  but this is starting the close the gap. Well done BOS!
title: Brilliant! Banking as it should be!

review:
Fantastic easy to use app. Excellent facilities to access and deal with u r banking. My only criticism is that it doesn't automatically log u out after a set time with no activity or if you leave the app without logging out and use other apps. I go back to it to my surprise it is still accessible!
Also under Pending transactions it doesn't show you ALL pending transactions ie regular standing order or direct debit but only card transactions
title: A couple but major draw backs

review:
I am using the latest version of the app and if is disappointing. 

The previous version was responsive and the keyboard popped up. Now the alphanumeric wheels are used and this slows entering details down. Personally I preferred the pop up keyboard and drop down lists. Also the password is always asked for, this may be for security reasons but it makes the app unwieldy. If security is required then ease implement the finger print function as other apps do.
title: Latest version not good

review:
I've been using the BoS online banking app for about 1 yr now and still to find a flaw or any annoying bugs/crashes. I use it on my iPhone or the iPad and so far so good. 

It really saves a lot of time logging on the laptop or PCs at work and I can do my banking on the move which is ideal coz I work long hours and mostly during office hours.

I would recommend this app to anyone who is already with BoS and would advise people with other banks to consider switching bank coz always had first rate customer service and rewards with them, unlike
my wife whoose family were with Clydesdale for many yes and had numerous issues and problems with them....she is now with BoS too! 

Make your life simple and less stressful - get this app and enjoy easy, quick online banking, cheers.
title: Fantastic, efficient banking app!!

review:
Very pleased with this. 
Quick to install, very quick to access, easy to make payments, easy to navigate - even if I can think of a few minor changes I'd like to make.  And I like the fact that the login credentials are the same as my online account. 

Don't understand another reviewer's gripe about the security call on installation. I selected the handset on which I was installing the software. Easy! 

Having spent a week on the road using this app, I can only think some reviewers hadn't taken the trouble to spend time using it before submitting a review - some stuff they say tells me they've not understood the menus! 

So credit where it's due - it's good to see my bank has tried to address its previously woeful mobile offering. And has done so in style! Well done guys!
title: Fast and functional.

review:
Normally just go in via the website for Internet banking and have never had a problem on ipad or laptop.   Decided to download this app as I had downloaded the RBS one to assist an elderly aunt and was impressed.

However, this one was awful as screen remains size for mobile 'phone so it takes ages.   Not impressed and I decided to delete the app.   Hate giving this review as I worked for the group..(Bank of Scotland) for over 30 years - in the GOOD OLD DAYS!!
title: Dreadful

review: This is a great app, very very convenient to use in every way bar one - login. Compared to the website, the app is very quick to log in, the memorable information approach instead of this AND your password makes login much quicker. However, my friends with RBS have the RBS app, on which you can log in using Touch ID which is miles more convenient (and equally, if not more safe) than the current method of memorable information
title: Needs Touch ID

review:
I now do almost all of my banking via the app as it has been made so much more user friendly.

Scrolling through accounts does seem to have become a bit tricky from the home screen as you end up selecting rather than moving through to the next, but this is a minor irritation.

Would be great if the iPhone's fingerprint technology could be adopted as an additional security measure for added peace of mind.
title: Couldn't live without it

review:
Great for finding cash machines and branches however won't let me log in to check or manage my accounts which is sorta the whole point of the APP really, I put in my password and I get a "sorry we had to log you out" message every time.  

The RBS personal banking APP is what this should be based on and I personally would have preferred to wait for a glitch free version than get this!
title: Fine unless you want to manage your accounts

review: The new refreshed app is a much better version. As a Halifax and Bos customer I can use this app for my Halifax account.  Hope Halifax go down the same route and re vamp there app. Would also be good if you could request replacement debit cards cheque books etc. Have banked with both banks a while but they could do better.  But overall a much better banking app from bank of Scotland.  Well done. Halifax next please .
title: New app

review: Was very impressed with the new update until i identified that when making a future dated payment, it in fact debits your account the day before the date instructed! Having run a third payment to confirm this bug, i spent 1 hour and 3 mins onto customer services who, because their had been no previous reports of this issue, discounted my concern. Surely just because i am the first to highlight a problem doesn't mean it should be discounted on that basis! Anyway, beware, i was put into overdraft on 2 occasions due to this bug.
title: Payment glitch

review: Much improved dedicated app that makes it much easier to sign in and check accounts. It really needs the ability to list all direct debits on an account along with last paid dates, rather than making you check through your statement. When future dating a payment it also says that it won't be received until the day after your payment date, don't know why this is when it should be going by Faster Payment. Otherwise a much improved experience.
title: Much improved, but...

review:
Not keen on the new update at all - the previous version was much more organised and cleaner looking.
I'm now no longer able to make a payment to my credit card using the app which is an inconvenience to me. Also, my credit card account has so far not been properly updated in terms of transactions and payments. When I check this on my desktop, my credit card account is up to date so this is causing me confusion when I view the account through my app. If these things were corrected then I'd find the app experience a bit more enjoyable.
title: Newest update

review: I find this app very easy to use for most of my banking needs. It is quick and easy to check balances & recent transactions. It's simple to transfer funds between accounts and make payments to my credit card or other bills. I very rarely have to use the full desktop website or phone banking anymore. Perfect for my needs.
title: Quick check banking

review:
Appallingly the app update lost ones saved "credentials" forcing re-registration of ones device. This coupled to the insistence on keyboard input in the userID and password field is irritating, as I cannot use my secure "Password Safe" app, I wind up with my credentials on display as I copy from one device to another

It's time to differentiate between true security and a theatre of security created by making it awkward for users to use

Once the device is set up, the app is useful until that time when setting up a new payee requires the manual (vs copy and paste) input of that password again
title: Infinitely irritating

review: Is not so bad like for normal personal banking user, good anought to check your balance and transver some founds to another existing reciver from your list. Is easy for use. More complicated action has to be done from computer but i think u still can do too mutch by mobile aps what made question reg safty. Option pay contack is not working, thats the ruson why i cut of one star, i do not use this any way but if is listed should be on working order . All the rest runing smouth and fast.
title: BOS aps

review:
This app is a vast improvement over the old one. Once setup and registered you only now need to use your memorable info to log in (those stupid scrolling entry drop downs are gone too). Also removed us the password entry everytime you want to make a payment. 

If you bank with the Halifax you can also use this app too!!

Only bad points are that there is no Direct Debit or Standing Order functions supported, and the link to the desktop app has been removed
title: So much better!! And Halifax customers can use it too!!

review:
Well done Hbos you got there in the end, incredible step forward, unfortunately for me it took too long as I have moved almost everything to RBS.

It would still be good to see a pin in place of the memorable info, other than that the functionality is in line with the others.  I am sure in a few years, considering the time to get here, the extra functions that RBS have I.e pay your contacts may eventually arrive
title: Got there in the end!

review: This app is really beneficial to me, being a bit if a spendaholic, I like to know how much I've got to play with! This app lets you keep an eye on your money with ease and a secure log in... BUT... It's far too slow on logging in now that once you click the app icon and get onto the security questions, it's another age waiting on those to load!! So make it quicker and it would be unstoppable!
title: Brilliant- but too slow!

review:
Very easy to use, I live a long drive from any banks so I use this for everything! The only thing that could be annoying is that when you put in the three digits (memorable info?) to open your accounts it doesn't give you a chance to confirm it, so if you put the last digit in wrong by mistake, that's you wasted 1 out of 3 try's to access your accounts. 
Anyway I love the app!
title: Brilliant

review: Really good,simple banking app. Use it all of the time as living rurally I have no choice as all our branches are closing or on restricted hours. App is great but in the past few months it has a habit of login out as soon as you try to open it. Really annoying as sometimes it keeps on doing it for several attempts before finally login on.  Apart from that I love it.
title: Great app when it loads

review:
This app used to be riddled with bugs, but the dev team have really listened to customer feedback and resolved every issue that existed.

It's a brilliant app that does what it should. I love the fact you don't need to go to the next space like the Santander app, when you input a digit it automatically moves to the next box for you to input the digit there and so on... That's the #1 feature to me!
title: Amazing

review: I used to use have a widows phone & the BOS app for windows was terrible, but this one is way better. Better access better layout & so much easier to use plus I can use all the app has to offer, not just the basic stuff, so all in all I'm glad I upgraded my phone it's made keeping track of my account less annoying.
title: Improvement

review: This app makes banking so simple, which is what it is designed to do. If you need to do more, like close an account, set-up a new payment, you simply just need to log in to internet banking via the internet browser on your phone instead. I feel very annoyed by the negative reviews on here as they are mainly unjust. It is so easy, and still extremely secure. I am very happy.
title: Great app

review: What I don't think anyone appreciates until they've set it up is you're logging on with just your memorable information so really quick and once completed security to authorise your phone and it means no more calls to send a payment. More functionality will come with time and until then there's the desktop. Be patient
title: It's works just fine

review: Seriously? It was fast, it was easy, it was very convenient so the point of the update was...,..???  I'm assuming app designer guy does this for a living or did you just give the job to some poor work experience kid.  Obviously the former as the latter would undoubtably have done a better job.  One star A: because no stars isn't an option and B: ok you got the logo on the app badge. Well done you x
title: If it ain't broke....,,

review:
Reading the other reviews I thought this was going to be rubbish, but I'm not having any issues with the app so far. It's really solid and there is a link to the desktop site for some of the bits you can't do in the app like managing standing orders and direct debits.

Shame others are having bother with it but for me it's fine.
title: No issues for me

review:
This is a major step up from the previous app. The combination of security (device recognition) and convenience (short password) make it a painless experience - unlike the previous iteration. 

In app is very clear typography and the navigation makes sense after you've had a play. It could develop a little more, and there have been a couple of bugs, but overall I enjoy using the app.
title: Fantastic user experience

review:
Functional app but an issue about real time balance updates - the transactions reflect changes but not the stated balance.  This may need to addressed in any future updates.
Disappointed to add that the balances do not reflect any transactions after completion, even if these are internal transfers.  In order to obtain the updated and correct balance you have to sign out and then sign back in.
title: Ari-ya-til

review:
My only gripe about this app is a very small one, within the "Pay an Account"option other BOS accounts are listed without names, only the account numbers.
This can make things slightly confusing. Perhaps if they had the names of the account holders. Other than that, this app is everything needed in a banking app.
Thank you.
title: Almost the perfect app.

review: Much better than the initial app. However recent updates have broken the app. I run iOS 8.1 but the app not loading the login page until the phone restarted, which is a pain. Also I have number of payees setup and I can't scroll down to get to the bottom few payees. Recent updates have killed the joy of using the app.
title: Need more work

review: I have BOS app on iPhone & Halifax on iPad & they are excellent!! Does everything no need to phone/go branch. Never had any problems been using Online 10yrs+ and app 4yrs, constantly being improved you can cancel & order lost/broken card, move money, set up/cancel standing orders/DD, Apply for other accounts and all sorts.  It's also very secure.
title: Best app compared to other banks I use

review: With my recent purchase of the new iPhone 6 plus I realised I would have to wait a bit before most of my apps would be updated but after 2 months of the phone being out I think it's time I start asking. I really like the app but the resolution is putting me off. In the next update I would really like if you could add the option of using Touch ID for accessing your account instead of the way that is currently being used. Thanks
title: App need updated

review: This app is perfect if you are a very busy person! It takes seconds to use and sort your finances! I do miss the texts if you are close to Your limit not that it happens often! Just when your busy you may forget to check your account! I also can't fault Bank of Scotland! Great bank and friendly service.
title: Busy mum/nan and full time worker

review: Fantastic app constantly keeps me up to date with my spending and so on. Great to always keep checking when using your card to buy things as I've went over my allowance a few times as some shops give u a floor balance so u think you have got money left in your account but actually already spent it so it's been a great help to me!!!
title: Bos

review:
A terrible excuse for an app - nothing more than a shoehorned portal to the mobile web site and even that doesn't offer full control of things like payments and standing orders etc. other banks do this much better - a pin protected interface to bypass the long and clumsy log in sequence would have redeemed this but hasn't been included. 

Just bookmark the mobile site in safari and save yourself the space on your homescreen. A very lazy effort at having an App.
title: Waste of space

review: Brilliant App! Don't even think about it, download this app immediately. It's easier than just signing in the normal way. We have so many passwords to remember nowadays. I forget mine a lot. So therefore I've lost count of all my different passwords. The fingerprint access is perfect for me. But the app too is brilliant. Don't delay download this app & I promise you won't be disappointed.
title: Fab App!!

review: Vast improvement on previous app. I'm a busy dad to two students which essentially means transferring the contents of my accounts to theirs. This app allows you to keep on top of balances of your own accounts and making payments and transfers is very slick and quick- I now rarely use my laptop for day- day transactions
title: Great for keeping on top of accounts

review:
Unlike a lot of the reviews I use this app all the time, anywhere, with no problems!

You can instantly transfer money between your accounts and keep an eye on your balance - next step would be notifications of low balances/ nearing overdraft limit etc...
title: Does everything, quick and mobile!

review: Really enjoy using this app however every single day at one point or another it won't let me log in because it says "sorry we are experiencing technical problems. Please try again later." Now I don't know if this is the app or the BoS servers but it's pretty annoying as it does happen very often.
title: Technical Problems

review: It's so useful to be able to check your current balance directly after you've bought something as well as keeping a track of what you have bought. Couldn't live with this as its so easy to transfer money to and from and contacts and between accounts!
title: Life saver

review: App looks great but still has bugs transactions are messed up from the 5th of Feb jumps back to the 7th and from the 3rd of feb back to 5th the sums are inconsistent with the with the totals after the transactions have been registered. Looks great but does the job like a prototype. Hope you get a hotfix for it coming soon.  It's a money utilising app from a respectable bank not Fruit Ninja.
title: Bug

review: I love this app üòÄ. I does exactly what is says on the tin.  It's easy to use and I use it daily. No more trips to the bank to move money.  I also like the fingerprint option instead of putting in the password stuff. One downside is the mobile app is slightly restricted in that I can removed contacts from my payment list.
title: It's a banker

review: Good improvements but I'm always sceptical of what happens to my transfer delays. E.g.'s 1 - pay off credit card, money leaves my account instantly, but clears my CC balance 2 or 3 days later. 2 - monthly loan payment leaves my account but again doesn't come off my loan amount balance for 2 or 3 days.  Multiply this by a few million customers and you have significant amounts of money in  'the ether'!
title: Constantly improving

review:
Not a bad effort from BOS, however seems rushed to market.

Error messages remain partially on the screen when closed, statements and transactions show, swipe to a new account and return and you are told that there are no transactions to view. App restart only way to get them back!

Account type names are missing display letters, still unable to view certain account types without going to the desktop version.
title: Good, but a few bugs

review: This ap is so useful, can access your bank account easily and carry out all sorts of transactions while away from home. It means you can always get up to date information and they even text you when your near your limit to avoid bank charges. Don't know how I managed before
title: Very useful

review: Very useful app for when I need to check my balance, move money around my accounts and transfer money to other people. Was a godsend while on my year exchange in Argentina to still be able to not only access my account in Scotland, but do almost anything I can do in the bank or online.
title: Very useful app

review: Brilliant app... I can't really find any fault with it at all. Intuitive and simple to use BOS have designed a complete wrap around service for customers to manage their money on the go. I can't imagine going back to use laptop or even telephone banking, this app is a must for all customers!!
title: Fast and convenient way to manage your money

review: So far, so good - much better than the old app and I love that you do not have to go through the tedious log on that the previous app had. Have been waiting a while for this kind of update! Only comment would be that I would prefer a 'pin' number of sorts rather than memorable data to log in.
title: Soooo much better, at last!

review: This app is ok, it gives you quite useful, standard information and at least you can read it (unlike when you use the desktop site on your phone).  Hopefully it will have more functionality as it gets updated over time but it's progress at least.
title: Does the basics

review:
This 'app' was long overdue but the wait certainly was not worth it.  
It offers no more than the mobile web page and is limited in its functionality by not allowing full account control. 
The login process is just as convoluted as the BOS web page and does not make for an easy process that you would normally associate with an app. Overall, it just seems to have evolved purely to have a presence on the app store rather than be a fully thought out 
app like some others that are available.
title: A lazy excuse for an app.

review:
So easy to use and handle. I ve not had a problem with it. Only suggestion I would say is to have access to change details if I am abroad because I was in China for a year and the Internet was atrocious and it would have helped if I could have used the app more then. 

Otherwise IS PERFECT!
title: Easy accessible and fantastic

review:
Pleased to see and actual app now for bank of Scotland as apposed to just a link to the mobile banking website. 

4 stars because I like the interface and how quick it is for me to log in using my memorable phrase. 

1 star off the 5 because it lacks the ability to pay my 'payee's'. I.e pay my bill like I can on the digital banking website.
title: Vast improvement in this new version

review: If asked what improvements I would like to make to this banking app. The answer is "nothing". Does everything that you need I a simple and user friendly manner.  Access all of the important information that you need. Even better to use than the desktop browser version.
title: Perfect

review: I work for the Royal Bank of Scotland and I bank with the Bank of Scotland. I love the Bank of Scotland and I LOVED the app. The update is horrible, it almost seems childish and the UI is cluttered and doesn't look sleek anymore. I understand there will no doubt be updates in the near future per reviews but I really really really don't like the new app at all
title: Not happy

review: This app is a fantastic benefit to me as I can do all my business online . I have mobility problems and it saves me time and great effort trying to get to the bank . I sometimes wonder how I managed without it . It's so easy to keep an eye on my purchases and I can also pay any bills that I have . Would recommend it
title: Bank of scotland

review: New update is fantastic.   Some people moaning about the UI I think new style is lovely and personally it's down to personal choice and you can please every one.    The actual app colours and style aside is fantastic. The best banking app I have used and I have used a lot.  Love Bank of Scotland. Would never change well done
title: Fantastic banking app

review: Use this app daily, it's great. Crashes from time to time which can be irritating when I really need it, especially as the website isn't great on mobile. Touch ID would really just make it better though I do like the fact it's only 3 touches to get into, so can't complain really!
title: So easy - could use Touch ID

review: I like the ease of use and quick log in. However, since the last update, when I log out but then try to return again, the page doesn't load properly. It's a shame because it's the best banking app I use.
title: Like the functionality but last update crashes

review: This app is great! The only problem I have with it is since iOS 8 came out sometimes my screen goes black and can't log in need to double click home button to close app then usually works after that when I try log in. Still great but want this problem fixed.
title: Great app

review: This is poor service updated app over a week ago and when I click on it since then it just flashes up and goes off.. Used to use it everyday and any other service would have had thus sorted within days... Over a week on and still unable to use it
title: Debansco

review: I've been using BoS remote banking for years - since the old HOBS.  Over time, I've seen this iteration morph from something that was barely useable to what it seems to be today - a thoroughly useable application I would hate to be without. Easy and logical to use - other banks would do well to take a look at this app.
title: Best version yet.

review: This app is great!!! Banking on the move couldn't be easier only thing I cannot find is where the messages are? When you get an email from the bank saying you have a new message please go online and see your message (or words to that effect) I can never get to read it!!
title: Ideal

review: Reviewed previously, re-submitting to improve rating.  Great to see pending transactions included.  Would love to be able to see direct debit due dates.  Transactions list still starts repeating intermittently towards start of month.  Overall a great app and hope additional functionality continues to be delivered.
title: Continued Improvement

review: This app is a massive improvement from the original one. The only criticism is that you can't see your mortgage statement on the mobile app. Also there has been a technical issue for some time now and the warning message is very vague. Maybe updates and an estimated time on when the app will be up and running again please.
title: Very good improvement
